substitution.copyText: '' For food and diet to some enterprise | '' That hath a stomack in't, which is no other | '' As it doth well appear unto our state, | '' But to recover of us by strong hand | '' and Terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands
'' The source of this our watch, and the chief head | '' Of this post haste, and romage in the land.

Well may it sort that this portentous figure | Comes armed through our watch so like the King | That was and is the question of these wars. | '' Hora. A mote it is to trouble the minds eye. | '' In the most high and flourishing state of Rome, | '' A little e'ere the mightiest Julius fell. | '' The graves stood tenantless, and the sheeted dead | '' Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets, | '' As Stars with trains of fire, and dews of blood, | '' Disasters in the Sun, and the moist Star, | '' Upon whose influence Neptunes Empire stands, | '' Was sick almost to Doomsday with eclipse, | '' And even the like precurse of fierce events, | '' As harbingers preceding still the fates | '' And Prologue to the Omen coming on, | '' Have heaven and earth together demonstrated | '' Unto our Climatures and Countrymen.

mark.name: X_sign
mark.text: For which they say you spirits oft walk in death,
